department: Environment and Climate Change Canada, including Parks Canada Agency
short_summary: Sentinel fishery using gillnets and longlines in NAFO division 4S
description: 1.2 Introduction In order to compile a meaningful estimate of the absolute abundance of cod in northern Gulf of St Lawrence, it is highly desirable that an independent system of assessment, which the sentinel fishery represents, be implemented. The goal of the sentinel fishery in the northern Gulf of St Lawrence is to develop an independent abundance indicator for the fishery, which will be used to adjust total allowable catch (TAC) annually. This system will consist of fixed-gear fisheries, which includes gillnet and longline fishing methods. The sentinel fisheries must be conducted according to the protocols provided by DFO Science Branch and under the supervision of a contractor. The purpose of the sentinel fishery is to provide an estimate of cod abundance and to assess the results of the abundance indicators. This information will be used by DFO management to manage the fishery.
